case.name: Sagacious Legal Pty Ltd v Lumley General Insurance Limited t/as Lumley Special Vehicles [2009] FCA 763 (17 July 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: leave for director of respondent company to appear
whether declaratory relief hypothetical. practice and procedure
transfer of proceeding to federal magistrates court
whether court can transfer "proceeding" which discloses no "matter".
transfer of proceedings to federal magistrates court
power of court to transfer proceedings on own motion under s 32ab of the federal court of australia act 1976 (cth) (the act)
jurisdiction of federal magistrates court to hear transferred matter brought under the administrative decisions (judicial review) act 1977 (cth)
application for relief under the human rights and equal opportunity commission act 1986 (cth)
application may be by a party or on court's own motion
insurance-public liability insurance; whether non-disclosure; whether relevant matters known to the insured or its broker

in public liability insurance, is the identity of the owner of the building a relevant matter; whether relevant matter known to insurer; whether extract from newspaper was knowledge or a means of knowledge; what is the significance of a survey undertaken by insurer; who has onus of proof of non-disclosure, the insurer or the injured plaintiff suing under s6 of the law reform (miscellaneous provisions) act 1946 ; whether there should be a retrial when judge's interlocutory ruling on onus held to be wrong.
transfer on initiative of the court
